com.impinj.octane

Class DirectionConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.impinj.octane.DirectionConfig

  • public class DirectionConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    A container that holds all of the configuration options for xArray's Direction feature.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectionConfig()
      The default constructor, sets DirectionMode to DirectionMode.HighPerformance and the tag age interval to five seconds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectionConfig

        public DirectionConfig()
        The default constructor, sets DirectionMode to DirectionMode.HighPerformance and the tag age interval to five seconds.

    • Method Detail

      • enableSector

        public void enableSector(short sector)
                  throws OctaneSdkException
        Adds the specified sector to the list of sectors that should be monitored for tag entrances, exits, and updates. Note that the set of enabled sectors must not include any two adjacent sectors, where 2 and 9 are also considered adjacent. Failure to follow this rule will result in an OctaneSdkException when you attempt to call ImpinjReader.applySettings(Settings).
        Parameters:
        sector - A number between 2 and 9 corresponding to the sector space beneath the xArray
        Throws:
        OctaneSdkException - When a number outside the 2-9 range (inclusive) is specified.

      • removeSector

        public void removeSector(short sector)
        Removes the specified sector from the list of sectors that should be monitored for tag entrances, exits, and updates. If the specified sector was never enabled, this call is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        sector - A number between 2 and 9 corresponding to the sector space beneath the xArray.

      • removeAllSectors

        public void removeAllSectors()
        Removes all sectors from the list of sectors that should be monitored for tag entrances, exits, and updates. If no sector was enabled, this call is a no-op.

      • isSectorEnabled

        public boolean isSectorEnabled(short sector)
        Tests if the specified sector is in the list of sectors that should be monitored for tag entrances, exits, and updates.
        Parameters:
        sector - A number between 2 and 9 corresponding to the sector space beneath the xArray.
        Returns:
        true if the sector is part of the enabled sector set, false otherwise.

      • isSectorConfigurationValid

        public boolean isSectorConfigurationValid()
        Tests that no two sectors in the set of enabled sectors are numerically consecutive, nor that both sectors 2 and 9 are enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration follows the above rules, false otherwise.

      • getEnabledSectors

        public java.lang.Short[] getEnabledSectors()
        Returns:
        An array of short values corresponding to the sectors that should be included for tag direction monitoring.

      • getUserTagPopulationLimit

        public short getUserTagPopulationLimit()
        Returns:
        Returns the user specified tag population limit.

      • setUserTagPopulationLimit

        public void setUserTagPopulationLimit(short userTagPopulationLimit)
        Parameters:
        userTagPopulationLimit - A user specified tag population limit.

      • getIsMaxTxPower

        public boolean getIsMaxTxPower()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the reader is configured to be running at its max transmit power. False, if a custom power is being used.

      • setIsMaxTxPower

        public void setIsMaxTxPower(boolean maxTxPower)
        Parameters:
        maxTxPower - Set to true if the maximum reader transmit power is desired. Set false if a custom transmit power is desired.

      • getTxPowerinDbm

        public double getTxPowerinDbm()
        Returns:
        Returns the transmission power currently set for this direction tracking session.

      • setTxPowerinDbm

        public void setTxPowerinDbm(double txPowerinDbm)
        Parameters:
        txPowerinDbm - Sets the transmission power to be used

      • getTagAgeIntervalSeconds

        public short getTagAgeIntervalSeconds()
        The "age interval" specifies how long a tag needs to go unseen before it's removed from the population of tags tracked for direction and an exit report is sent.
        Returns:
        the current value for the tag age interval.

      • setTagAgeIntervalSeconds

        public void setTagAgeIntervalSeconds(short tagAgeIntervalSeconds)
        The "age interval" specifies how long a tag needs to go unseen before it's removed from the population of tags tracked for direction and an exit report is sent.
        Parameters:
        tagAgeIntervalSeconds - the desired value for the tag age interval

      • getUpdateIntervalSeconds

        public short getUpdateIntervalSeconds()
        Specifies how often update reports are sent when updates are enabled.
        Returns:
        the current value of the Report Interval.
        See Also:
        LocationConfig.setUpdateReportEnabled(boolean)

      • setUpdateIntervalSeconds

        public void setUpdateIntervalSeconds(short updateIntervalSeconds)
        Specifies how often update reports are sent when updates are enabled. This method sets that interval to the desired value in seconds.
        Parameters:
        updateIntervalSeconds - the time between report generation, in seconds. If the provided value is zero or negative, a value of 1 will be applied.
        See Also:
        LocationConfig.setUpdateReportEnabled(boolean)

      • isUpdateReportEnabled

        public boolean isUpdateReportEnabled()
        When update reports are enabled, direction reports are sent by the reader periodically for all tags in the direction database
        Returns:
        true if the update report is enabled
        See Also:
        LocationReport

      • setUpdateReportEnabled

        public void setUpdateReportEnabled(boolean updateReportEnabled)
        Parameters:
        updateReportEnabled - When true, update reports on the current population of tags will be sent.
        See Also:
        LocationReport

      • isEntryReportEnabled

        public boolean isEntryReportEnabled()
        When enabled, an entry report is sent immediately upon the tag entering the field of view of the reader.
        Returns:
        true if entry reports are enabled.
        See Also:
        LocationReport

      • setEntryReportEnabled

        public void setEntryReportEnabled(boolean entryReportEnabled)
        When enabled, an entry report is sent immediately upon the tag entering the field of view of the reader.
        Parameters:
        entryReportEnabled - true to enable entry reports
        See Also:
        LocationReport

      • isExitReportEnabled

        public boolean isExitReportEnabled()
        When enabled, an exit report is generated when the tag has not been seen by the reader in the tag age Interval.
        Returns:
        true if enabled
        See Also:
        LocationConfig.setTagAgeIntervalSeconds(short), LocationReport

      • setExitReportEnabled

        public void setExitReportEnabled(boolean exitReportEnabled)
        When enabled, an exit report is generated when the tag has not been seen by the reader in the tag age Interval.
        Parameters:
        exitReportEnabled - true to enable exit reports
        See Also:
        LocationReport

      • isDiagnosticReportEnabled

        public boolean isDiagnosticReportEnabled()
        When enabled, diagnostic reports are generated at each update interval and sent to the application
        Returns:
        true if diagnostic reports are enabled
        See Also:
        LocationReport

      • setDiagnosticReportEnabled

        public void setDiagnosticReportEnabled(boolean diagnosticReportEnabled)
        When enabled, diagnostic reports are generated at each update interval and sent to the application
        Parameters:
        diagnosticReportEnabled - true to enable diagnostic reports
        See Also:
        LocationReport

      • getFieldOfView

        public DirectionFieldOfView getFieldOfView()
        Returns:
        The current field of view setting enabled, i.e. WIDE or NARROW

      • setFieldOfView

        public void setFieldOfView(DirectionFieldOfView fieldOfView)
        Sets the field of view for tag direction tracking. Narrow corresponds to ring 2, while Wide corresponds to ring 4.
        Parameters:
        fieldOfView - Determines which "rings" are enabled when reading and tracking tags.

      • getMode

        public DirectionMode getMode()
        Returns:
        The performance/sensitivity mode enabled for this direction reporting session.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(DirectionMode mode)
        Parameters:
        mode - Sets the performance/sensitivity mode for this direction reporting session.
